Content: A number of new buildings constructed under “Pibidemu Polonnaruwa” program were opened today under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena. A new building of Kumudu-pura Primary school was vested in students by the President. He was warmly welcomed and escorted to the school by the students. After religious observations a memorial plaque was unveiled. The building was constructed at an expense of 5.5 million rupees. The President also donated books and stationery to the school. Then a building of Hingurak-goda, Pahala Amba-gas-wewa Sri Rahula junior school, which was built at a cost of 5.6 million rupees, was opened.Several projects were carried out in the aim of improving religious resilience. The new Sunday school building of Medirigiriya Sri Jayabimbaarama Viharaya constructed under “Pibidemu Polonnaruwa” program was opened by the President. 2.8 million rupees was spent on the project. The President then attended the opening of the new building of Medirigiya Sri Wijayarama Viharaya which was completed at a cost of 3.5 million rupees. The new Dhana Shala of Madirigiriya Nawa Nagara Saraswathi Pirivena was vested in maha sanga by the President. 7.4 million rupees were allocated to the construction of the building. President Maithripala Sirisena also received the blessings of maha sanga.
